methods.name: customizeDialog
methods.description: Customizes the user's dialog for all instances of ZingGrid

params.description:
The type of dialog to customize. If you set as null, the config will be applied to all dialogs. Options are:
  • record-create
  • record-delete
  • record-info
  • record-update
  • view-error
  • view-info
  • view-success
  • view-warn
  • zg-version
params.name: type

params.description:
Options for the data retrieval. Options are:
  • cancel: Text for the Cancel Button
  • confirm: Text for the Confirm Button
  • label: Label to display on the Dialog
params.name: config

returns.description: Returns the component so that you can chain methods together

params.description: The Date to format
params.name: date

params.description: The tokenized format to format the date
params.name: format

params.description: The locale to use for the formatting.  Optional.
params.name: locale

methods.name: fromNow
methods.description: Formats a Date in from now format

params.description: The Date to format
params.name: date

params.description: Indicates if we should include 'ago/to' to indicate past/future
params.name: raw

methods.name: registerAdapter
methods.description:
Register a method to make connecting a remote data src to your grid even easier. If you
have your own standardized endpoints this is very useful. A way for us to provide an ES6 style import
 mechanism and pattern for building custom data sources.

params.description: The string name for the adapter
params.name: sType

params.description:
Option list of of adapter variables you want to define. You can define ANY
zg-param name value pair here in this option. Refer to the Store.js variable this.oDefaultDataFormat
params.name: oOptions

methods.name: registerCellType
methods.description:
Register a custom column type to reduce redundant markup and re-use
similar code.

params.description: Name of cell type.
params.name: sType

params.description: An object to define the renderer and/or editor for the cell type.
params.name: oOptions

methods.name: registerEditor
methods.description:
Register the life cycle hooks for cell editing. This allows you to import
and inherit editors for your library.

params.description: Cell type editor to override
params.name: sCellType

params.description: Object containing editor hooks
params.name: oConfig

methods.name: registerMethod
methods.description:
Register a method to make it available to ZingGrid even if it outside the window scope.
This can be used to make a method accessible to renderer, editor, sorter, and custom styles
This is useful for methods within a class or local methods.

params.description: The method that you wish to expose to ZingGrid.
params.name: method

params.description:
The name to refer to the method.  If the method is not anonymous, the name will default to the
name of the method.  If it is anonymous, a name must be set.  Whatever is set here is how you should refer to the method
in the grid. Optional.
params.name: name

params.description: The scope of the method.  When the method is called `this` will be set to the `scope` value. Optional.
params.name: scope

methods.name: registerNamespace
methods.description:
Register a namespace to make it available to ZingGrid even if it outside the window scope.
Once a namespace is registered, the methods within the namespace will be accessible to ZingGrid without having to call `ZingGrid.registerMethod`

params.description: The namespace that you wish to expose to ZingGrid.
params.name: namespace

params.description: The name to refer to the namespace. Optional.
params.name: name

params.description:
The scope of the namespace.  When a method within the namespace is called, `this` will be set to the `scope` value.
Defaults to the namespace itself. Optional.
params.name: scope

methods.name: registerValidator
methods.description:
Register the life cycle hooks for cell validation. This allows you to import
and inherit validators for your library.

params.description: The validator that you wish to expose to ZingGrid.
params.name: oValidator

params.description: The name to refer to the validator. Optional.
params.name: name

params.description: The scope of the method.  When the method is called `this` will be set to the `scope` value. Optional.
params.name: scope

methods.name: searchIsTable
methods.description:
Searches for table element(s) with the `[is="zing-grid"]` attribute to
insert the zing-grid. This method should only be used when `table[is="zing-grid"]`
is added after the Document has been loaded.
